questions.question_text: What information is provided in Logan Activities under Visibility Reports?

choices.B: A list of last endpoints that a user logged in to
choices.C: A list of users who are remotely logged on to devices based on local IP and local port
choices.A: A list of all logons for all users
choices.D: A list of unique users who are remotely logged on to devices based on the country

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Checking o documentation and found this "Only provides a summary of the last logon activity for users."

Selected Answer: B
Upon checking B is the answer

questions.question_text: What command should be run to verify if a Windows sensor is running?
When configuring a specific prevention policy, the admin can align the policy to two different types of groups, Host Groups and which other?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
Prevention Policies are created based on the OS (Windows, MAC and Linux policies). Once a prevention policy is created, three options appear on top: Settings, Assigned Host Groups and Assigned Custom IOAS (tested on Crowdstrike).
Therefore, Host Groups and Custom IOAS are the two different types of groups a prevention policy can be aligned to.
Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct, tested in UI
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A - Custom IOA Groups. The prevention policies page seperates each policy by Win/Mac/Linux however a specific policy can be assigned to host groups and custom IOA Groups, therefore the answer is A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: D
If you go to the Prevention policies tab you will see Windows/Mac/Linux policies segregation. Once you choose OS only then you can assign a host group to the specific prevention policy. Each OS has a different set of prevention policies and each prevention policy is assignable to a specific host group. The answer is D.

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer is A
Correct Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A
Correct answer is A :)

Selected Answer: A
The two groups are Host Groups and Custom IOAs
